reasoning: Acute pyelonephritis incidence estimates vary globally from 150-450 per 100k depending on definition (symptomatic vs all UTI with renal involvement). Using conservative global average of ~250 per 100k based on WHO epidemiological data and regional registries. Acute condition, so incidence is appropriate metric.
source: Hooton TM. (2012). Uncomplicated urinary tract infection. N Engl J Med. 366(11):1028-37
